cardDescription: Answers to frequently asked questions about Ma'aser Kesafim

questions.question: From what exactly is ma'aser separated?
questions.answer: Ma'aser is separated from all types of income: salary, business profits, interest, monetary gifts, inheritance, and more. A rabbi should be consulted for special cases.

questions.question: Is it permissible to pay debts from ma'aser funds?
questions.answer: As a rule, one should not pay existing debts or obligations from ma'aser funds. The ma'aser is intended for charity and not for paying personal debts.

questions.question: To whom can ma'aser funds be given?
questions.answer: Ma'aser funds are primarily intended for the poor, but can also be donated to Torah institutions, free-loan societies (Gemachim), and for the support of Torah. A rabbi should be consulted regarding specific purposes.

questions.question: Is it permissible to make a condition on ma'aser funds?
questions.answer: It is permissible to stipulate at the beginning of the separation that one may use the ma'aser funds for needy relatives or specific charitable purposes.
